metadata.title: CVE-2022-31629 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions before 7.4.31, 8.0.24 and 8.1.11, the vulnerability enablesnetwork and same-site attackers to set a standard insecure cookie in thevictim's browser which is treated as a `__Host-` or `__Secure-` cookie byPHP applications.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm5
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm5
php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm5

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm5').
